com.lambdaworks.redis.protocol

Class Command<K,V,T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.common.util.concurrent.AbstractFuture<T>
      • com.lambdaworks.redis.protocol.Command<K,V,T>
  • Type Parameters:
    K - Key type.
    V - Value type.
    T - Command output type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<T>, RedisCommand<K,V,T>, RedisFuture<T>, Future<T>

    public class Command<K,V,T>
extends com.google.common.util.concurrent.AbstractFuture<T>
implements RedisCommand<K,V,T>
    A redis command and its result. All successfully executed commands will eventually return a CommandOutput object.
    Author:
    Will Glozer

      • setException

        public boolean setException(Throwable exception)
        Description copied from interface: RedisCommand
        Subclasses should invoke this method to set the result of the computation to an error, throwable. This will set the state of the future to COMPLETED and invoke the listeners if the state was successfully changed.
        Specified by:
        setException in interface RedisCommand<K,V,T>
        Overrides:
        setException in class com.google.common.util.concurrent.AbstractFuture<T>
        Parameters:
        exception - the exception that the task failed with.
        Returns:
        true if the state was successfully changed.

        Specified by:
